Reviews.Title: “A great place with an awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: rabbitrun_10
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time during our three days at Bradford on the Lake, but that's not what inspired me to write this. I left a valuable gold chain in my room and didn't realize it until we were gone. They found it and mailed it back to me, and I am very grateful. Really nice people!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Resort”
Reviews.Author: Plazastar
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was concerned about the Bradford property. However, after checking in and taking a tour of the property we were very satisfied with the resort. We had two adjoining rooms and they were wonderful. The mattresses are great, the rooms were kept clean and the two pools and hot tub were wonderful for our family. They may not have a lakeside advantage but the property is very well kept up. There was even a wedding while we were there.The continential breakfast (cereal and mini donuts, milk and juice)tied us over until we could eat breakfast in Branson. Having mini fridges in our rooms was also helpful. We plan to stay again next year although the property will only be open for reservations from May thru August. Our recommendation book early for the condos. A wonderful family-friendly resort.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: legalbreeze
Reviews.Content: We just pulled in from a get away to Branson where we stayed at Bradford on the Lake. We chose this hotel because we have stayed at its sister property, Bradford B&B which is wonderful. we booked a king, lakeside rm, rm 114. Upon arrival, we discovered the only view is a very small glimpse of the lake if you look through several other properties and trees. We could live with that because while older, the property is actually really neat. Due to my husband getting ill, we were in bed and sound asleep by 10pm. Around 11pm., we heard knocking at the door and before we could answer it, someone was using a key to enter our room. I started screaming, and my husband ran full speed into the door with his shoulder, slamming it. We called the front desk prior to calling 911 and learned that they were trying to check in another family into our rm. I was so upset being woken from a solid sleep I couldnt get back to sleep all night. I really thought someone was breaking in. Then, to top it off, the room was to include breakfast from 7:30-9am. Well, there was no breakfast and the entire office building was locked up, lights off, no one there. We had given up and just wanted to check out, but couldnt because no one there. Finally, I called the sister property who called a manager who came over and checked us out. No breakfast and no offer to make any of this right. We are done with this family of properties which is too bad because the B and B was a really classy act. I am sure the manager will respond to this post, and let me just say regardless of what he writes, he was face to face with me this morning and didnt do a single thing to make this right, didnt even acknowledge that someone coming into our rm wasnt ok. He tried to say we were a walk in and it was somehow our fault, and NO we werent, we had reservations for some time. Then it was just that well the manager has to check the rm before renting it. HOW ABOUT KEEPING TRACK OF WHO YOU RENT ROOMS TO? And if you arent sure, for goodness sake CALL BEFORE ENTERING A ROOM IN THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT AND GIVING PEOPLE A HEART ATTACK!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: arow97
Reviews.Content: I, frankly, chose this hotel for the price. It was the least expensive lodging listed on www.reservebranson.com (my favorite website for booking anything in Branson!). After reading reviews, I was a little worried, but not enough to go for something more expensive. I'm glad I wasn't scared away! I thought it to be a great value for the price. The room was clean and I loved the homey furniture. It didn't feel like I was staying in another cookie-cutter hotel. The room had it's own character. I loved that! My husband thought the room was a bit small, but he has little hotel experience, and I didn't see anything wrong with the size. It was about what I would expect. The one problem we did have was that our door was a french door with blinds, and no curtains. At night, parking lot lights and any passing headlights were pretty bright. And when the sun rose in the morning, it shined bright and early into our room. I had an eye mask for just such an occasion, but my husband did not and he was not very happy about it. As far as the location, we thought it was perfect as the sole purpose of our trip was to visit Silver Dollar City and this hotel was the perfect location, as the park gets a lot of traffic from Branson on 76, we were able to avoid all the traffic and slide right in. It was absolutely wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: jake675
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. The service was exquisite and surpassed all of my expectations. They caterered to my family very well and had extremely adequate accomadations for us all. I especialy felt that the staff was amazing!! They were overly nice to us all and did all that they could to make our stay as comfortable as possible. Finally our rooms were spacious, clean, and gorgeous, the maids were very nice and did wonderful jobs. I will definately be returning for another stay. Thanks Bradford on the Lake!!!

Reviews.Title: “bradford on the lake is ok”
Reviews.Author: wellsms
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at the Bradford on the lake. It is convenient to Silver Dollar City, just down the road, less than 5 minutes. The beds were very comfy, had 4 regular pillows and 1 small pillow on each bed. The bed had 2 sheets sandwiched with a blanket between and a bedspread on it. The room had the look of your bedroom at home. Silk flowers on the round bedside table, pretty curtains, plus a valance on the wall between the sink area of the bathroom and the bedroom. Our room was always cleaned and re-stocked during our 4 day stay. What we did not like, no elevator, so ask for a 1st floor room if needed. The curtains do not close, there are mini-blinds, but we like it real dark at night, so I had to resort to using clothes pins to pull the curtains closed. The room had a musty smell, which I wish I had some Fabreze to use in it, I think that would of helped, maybe an air-conditioning problem, I don;t know. We never heard anyone during our stay, so it must be pretty sound-proof. It is maybe a 15-20 minute drive into Branson for shows or food, there are very few places to eat in West Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: inveni0
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the privilege to book a unit in the Chalet while they were still available. Ours was a one bedroom, one bath unit with a massive jacuzzi tub in a window that looked into the trees of the Ozark Mountains. It was great and very private. The unit also had its own deck, great for relaxing. The full kitchen made preparing meals for our 4-night stay a breeze, and it was stocked with most every utensil we needed. The King size bed was incredibly comfortable, and the big screen T.V. in the living room was great to watch while snuggled up on one of the two overstuffed sofas. The Bradford on the Lake also had two outdoor pools available. We used the pool on the back patio of the property. The water was great, and the patio overlooked Table Rock Lake. You could watch the sunset from the hot tub every evening. Beautiful! We had a very relaxing time and feel that couples traveling can enjoy this location as much or more than families traveling with children. We'll definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: cenglish
Reviews.Content: It looks ok from the outside. Our room was outdated - but worse than that, it was not clean. The room has a musty smell and the bathroom flooring looks like there had been a bad leak or something had spilled on it and stained it. If it had not been 11:30 at night and we had not traveled all day, I would not have stayed there. The pull out couch was falling apart and dirty. Based upon the room that we stayed in, my experience was that the hotel was not in good repair and did not look or feel clean.

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: mrskittie
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a Memorial Weekend stay at Bradford on the Lake. It was adequate but disappointing. We booked a lodge room that showed four poster beds in the picture. That's not what was in the room. They cover themselves by saying that rooms are continually redecorated therefore a room can be different from pictured. The quality of the bed was above average but there were ants in the room. The pool and hot tub looked nice, but we didn't have time to use them. Oh, and the continental breakfast was a joke. Coffee, cold cereal, skim milk, orange juice and tiny powdered sugar donuts. We were planning to go to the Bradford Inn (a sister property) in September, but we may rethink that.

HotelInfo.Name: Bradford on the Lake
HotelInfo.Address: 2601 Indian Point Rd, Branson, MO 65616
